params._slot: - The slot to compute round for

params._executionDelayInRounds: - A delay for how quickly a passing proposal can be executed.                                  When used together with a `_slasher` that has VETO functionality this is the time                                  that the vetoer have to act.
params._instance: - The specific rollup that the proposer will be used for
params._lifetimeInRounds: - A deadline for when the passing proposal must have been executed.
params._roundSize: The number of signals that can be cast in a round.
params._slasher: - The entity that can slash on the _instance                    The EmpireSlashingProposer `address(this)` should be able to use the slasher for this contract to                    make sense.
params._slashingQuorum: The number of signals needed in a round for a slash to pass.

signal(address).details: this only works if msg.sender is the current signaler

params._payload: - The address of the IPayload to signal support for

returns._0: True if executed successfully, false otherwise

params._payload: - The payload to signal support for

returns._0: True if executed successfully, false otherwise

submitRoundWinner(uint256).details: calls `_handleRoundWinner` on the implementing contract with the winning payload, if applicable.

returns._0: True if executed successfully, false otherwise

SLASHING_PROPOSER_TYPE().notice: Type of slashing proposer (either Tally or Empire)

computeRound(uint256).notice: Computes the round at the given slot

getCurrentRound().notice: Computes the round at the current slot

signalCount(address,uint256,address).notice: Fetch the signal count for a specific payload in a specific round on a specific instance

signalWithSig(address,(uint8,bytes32,byt.notice: Signal support for a payload with a signature from the current signaler

submitRoundWinner(uint256).notice: Submit the round winner to the implementation's `_handleRoundWinner` function
